home.intro: Three companies, two continents, no outside capital.
home.value_p1: Spielzüge 是我对自己创业项目的称呼。每个企业解决的问题各不相同，但它们都拥有相同的基因：没有外部资本、没有臃肿的团队、无需等待许可。目标始终如一：利用我所学到的一切，设计出最优雅、最节省资本的连锁系统组合。三家公司，两个大陆，一个运营商。
home.footer: Hamburg. Da Nang. Wherever the work is.
home.dnbv_deep: 15 properties in Vietnam, managed from Hamburg. Built the team, the ops, the booking engine that competes with Airbnb on direct bookings.
home.aa_deep: Pricing tools tell you what to charge. Nobody tells you who you're charging. I'm building the demand visibility layer that fills that blind spot.
home.fh_deep: One mentor, one hour, one person helped. That math never scales. AI agents trained on real frameworks change the ratio.

spielzuege_index.title: Spielzüge
spielzuege_index.subtitle: /ˈʃpiːlˌtsyːɡə/ — German for strategic moves.
spielzuege_index.forgehouse_desc_1: Most mentorship platforms sell access to a calendar. ForgeHouse trains AI agents on a mentor's actual frameworks, then lets anyone access that thinking on demand.
spielzuege_index.forgehouse_desc_2: Category, positioning, product, and live deployment in a single session. The agent went live the same day.
spielzuege_index.gpu_desc_1: Pre-revenue infrastructure company selling managed compute to emerging markets. No operating system, no validated pricing, no GTM sequence. Just a founder with technical depth and warm leads going cold.
spielzuege_index.gpu_desc_2: Built the full EOS foundation, staged go-to-market, and pricing architecture. Then told the founder he wasn't ready yet and walked away from the revenue. He wrote a recommendation the same day.

gpu.title: GPU计算初创公司
gpu.hero_desc: Pre-revenue compute company with technical depth and no go-to-market. I redesigned the entire business model, built a 4-stage market penetration strategy, and architected cash flow before a single customer signed. Then walked away when the fit wasn't right.
gpu.situation_p1: The founder had deep infrastructure knowledge and a clear technical thesis: resell managed GPU compute to companies locked out of hyperscaler pricing. He could build the stack. What he couldn't see was the path from "I have compute" to "I have a business."
gpu.situation_p2: When I came in, the positioning was scattered. Half B2C ("the cooler AWS for young people"), half B2B, with no clear first customer. Website looked AI-generated. No pricing validation. No discovery calls. No understanding of payment terms with his own supplier. He was about to spend his last money buying infrastructure before talking to a single prospect.
gpu.step1_desc: Repositioned the entire business from vague "cool AWS for Gen Z" to a specific, defensible position: B2B infrastructure for emerging markets, starting with Nigeria. One country. One value proposition. Economic nationalism as the wedge: "Your data stays in Nigeria."
gpu.step2_desc: Designed a strategy where each stage funds the next. No outside capital needed at any point.
gpu.stage1: Resell compute at price parity. Win on nationalism, not price. Validate with 10 paying customers from warm network.
gpu.stage2: Managed deployment layer. "I push code and it works." 3-5x markup over raw compute. This is where real margin lives.
gpu.stage3: Identity layer. Emerges naturally from 30-50 companies authenticating through your stack. You don't build KYC. You observe the pattern and unify it. The identity graph becomes the moat.
gpu.stage4: App marketplace. Identity and payments solved. Third-party developers build on the stack because the hard problems are done. Transaction fees on every API call.
gpu.step3_desc: The founder was about to pay his infrastructure provider upfront. I redesigned the model: charge customers on the 1st, pay the supplier at end of month. Positive float from day one. Then reframed the supplier relationship entirely. The supplier needs demand generators. We are their next market. Negotiate from that position, not as a small buyer begging for credit.
gpu.step4_desc: Stopped him from buying infrastructure before talking to a single prospect. Designed a discovery call sequence using his existing network. No cold outreach. Every call ends with "Who should I talk to next?" so the pipeline generates itself. The Mom Test applied: learn what they need, don't pitch what you have.
gpu.step5_desc: Full EOS implementation: vision, core values, quarterly rocks, weekly accountability. Plus a branded proposal system, consulting agreement, and interactive execution documents. One URL, everything in it.
gpu.decision_p1: After the alignment call, it became clear the engagement wouldn't work. Not because of capability on either side, but because of timing and priorities. The founder needed to resolve upstream questions before a strategic consulting layer would deliver value.
gpu.decision_p2: I told him directly. We parted on good terms. He wrote a LinkedIn recommendation the same day.
gpu.decision_p3: Walking away from revenue when you're pre-revenue yourself is not comfortable. But taking on an engagement where the prerequisites aren't met burns both parties. The consulting only works when the founder is ready to execute on the output.
gpu.shows_1_text: Repositioned the company, designed the revenue architecture, and sequenced 4 stages of market penetration in a single session.
gpu.shows_2_text: Reframed the infrastructure provider relationship from 'small buyer' to 'demand generator for your next market.' Changes the entire negotiation dynamic.
gpu.shows_3_text: Stopped a founder from spending his last money on infrastructure. Designed GTM that validates demand with zero capital deployed.
gpu.shows_4_text: The hardest consulting skill is telling a client they're not ready yet. Revenue lost, trust gained.
gpu.transparency: This engagement did not result in an ongoing contract. It's included here because the work was real, the frameworks were delivered, and the outcome (walking away) is as much a part of strategy as the wins.

forgehouse.title: 锻造屋
forgehouse.hero_desc: From concept to live product in 3 hours.
forgehouse.problem_p1: Mentorship is broken in two directions. Experienced operators want to share what they know but don't have time for 1-on-1 calls. Founders who need guidance can't afford $500/hour and can't wait three weeks for a calendar slot.
forgehouse.problem_p2: The knowledge exists. The delivery mechanism doesn't.
forgehouse.insight_p1: What if the mentor didn't need to be in the room? Train an AI agent on a mentor's real expertise, frameworks, and thinking patterns. The mentor contributes once. The agent serves thousands. Available at midnight on a Sunday when the founder is stuck and needs a sounding board.
forgehouse.hour1_desc: Revenue model, mentor split (75/25), category definition. Not a chatbot company. A mentorship platform where AI is the delivery mechanism.
forgehouse.hour2_desc: Full design language from scratch. Not a template. Landing page, mentor profiles, agent chat interface, pricing structure.
forgehouse.hour3_desc: Live at forgehouse.io. First mentor onboarded with a personalized contribute page. Analytics wired. Everything works.
forgehouse.for_mentors_desc: Contribute your expertise once. Earn 75% of subscription revenue from your agent. No calendar management. No calls. Your knowledge works while you sleep.
forgehouse.for_founders_desc: Access to experienced operators' thinking. Not generic AI. Agents trained on real frameworks from people who built real companies. Available instantly.
forgehouse.friedrich_desc: A free blended agent gives everyone access to collective mentor wisdom. Subscriptions unlock individual mentor agents. Free tier drives adoption, paid tier drives revenue. The mentors subsidize their own distribution.
forgehouse.role_design: Full design system, built from scratch
forgehouse.result_p1: A live product with its first mentor, first traffic, and a revenue model that compounds without scaling headcount. Built in an afternoon.
forgehouse.result_p2: The constraint was never time or money. It was seeing the full picture clearly enough to build it in one pass.*
forgehouse.result_footnote: *The actual constraint was GoDaddy DNS propagation. The product was done before the domain pointed to it.
forgehouse.cta_post: Read the launch post on Indie Hackers

alignment.hero_sub: 大多数合伙关系都会出错的地方从来都不在合同里。
alignment.intro_1: 这就是我的为人和工作方式。不是简历版本。实际的操作系统：我如何做决定、如何沟通、如何处理摩擦，以及我的价值观。如果我们要一起工作，这就是你要签约的内容。
alignment.intro_2: 大多数人都会跳过这一部分。他们谈论项目、条款和时间表。然后六个月过去了，项目出了问题，却没人能解释原因。这几乎从来不是工作的问题。而是下面的线路。
alignment.contrast_1: 一个人优化速度，另一个人优化共识。
alignment.contrast_2: 一个人说出了自己的想法，另一个人则用三层外交辞令加以包装。
alignment.contrast_3: 一个在 90% 的时候出货，另一个在 99% 的时候放不下。
alignment.intro_3: 价值观不一致不会导致争吵。它们会造成缓慢、无形的摩擦，消耗双方的精力，直到有人在没有理由的情况下退出。
alignment.drive_desc: 我不等待许可、动力或合适的时机。在条件完美之前，工作就已经开始了。高能量不是副作用，而是引擎。如果你需要别人告诉你开始，那我们就不在一条起跑线上。
alignment.craft_desc: 没有 "足够好"。如果发货了，就应该让人觉得有人关心。细节不是细节。格式、跟进、发货前的额外检查。这不是完美主义。这是对作品和收件人的尊重。
alignment.clarity_desc: 说你的意思。只说一次。不要遮遮掩掩，不要铺垫，不要外交迷雾。如果有什么不妥，我会告诉你。我也希望得到同样的回应。清晰并不是为了直率而直率。这是获得信任的最快途径。
alignment.culture_sub: 基于 Erin Meyer 的 "文化地图"。我在工作关系中的重要轴心位置。
alignment.culture_quote_1: 良好的沟通准确、简单、明确、清晰。信息是按其表面价值表达和理解的。
alignment.culture_quote_2: 信任是通过工作建立起来的。我们合作愉快，我们喜欢对方的工作，我们喜欢对方，所以我信任你。
alignment.pi_sub: 基于预测指数。行为 DNA。不是个性，不是偏好。是内在的模式。
alignment.pi_quote_1: 自我启动、自我激励、以目标为导向的冒险家。这种行为模式非常广泛，这意味着观察到的行为表现非常强烈，需求感受非常强烈。
alignment.pi_quote_2: 敢于冒险，敢于尝试，关注未来目标；更关心他们要去的地方，而不是他们如何到达那里，也不是他们曾经去过的地方。
alignment.pi_source: 预测指数行为报告，2026 年 2 月
alignment.pi_label: 预测指数：风险投资人简介。
alignment.cta_sub: 没有推销，没有牌面。只有两个人在想是否合适。
alignment.scheduling_sub: 我如何对待最后期限和时间承诺
alignment.trust_sub: 如何建立信任：通过交付还是通过关系
alignment.communication_sub: 我说话的方式：明确而简短，或裹挟在上下文中
alignment.feedback_sub: 我如何提出批评：直截了当还是软化
alignment.extraversion_desc: 注重任务，私密性强，不需要听众
alignment.patience_desc: 紧张、不安、需要变化和节奏
alignment.formality_desc: 灵活、不拘一格、容忍不确定性
